newsitem.title: USA: Hungarian Tel sees 160,000 access lines.
newsitem.headline: Hungarian Tel sees 160,000 access lines.

text.p: Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp said on Friday that it has 100,000 telephone access lines in place in Hungary and expects to have 160,000 lines in place by the end of 1997.

The company said the 100,000 lines gives it a penetration level of 14 percent of the population of about 715,000 in its access areas. Hungarian Telephone said it aims to have a penetration level of 22 percent by the end of 1997.
The company operates through four Hungarian subsidiaries which have been granted 25-year telecommunications concessions by the Hungarian government, Hungarian Telephone said.
